item.title: [PI] ::changepass / ::changepassword [PI]
item.dc:creator: @matiasmunk matiasmunk
item.description:
@matiasmunk wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][code=Java]
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“changepass”) &&
!playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“changepassword”)) {
String[] args = playerCommand.split();
for (int i : args) {
c.playerPass = args[i];
c.sendMessage("Your new password is: " + c.playerPass + “.”);
}
}

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“changepassword”) &&
!playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“changepass”)) {
String[] args = playerCommand.split();
for (int i : args) {
c.playerPass = args[i];
c.sendMessage("Your new password is: " + c.playerPass + “.”);
}
}
[/code]
Try that.

Use both ::changepass and ::changepassword [/quote]

You also can use both with my command + mines shorter but i bet urs is more stable am i rite? Anyways thanks

ytoiu look at this post
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,480645.msg3519284.html#msg3519284

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ::changepass / ::changepassword [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“matiasmunk, post:9, topic:384871”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=480637.msg3519267#msg3519267 date=1299281222]

If you look at changepassword, it has a part of changepass. So when going through your commands, the program will go through changepass first, and check if it’s actually there, which it is, then will do the the rest of the command.

Once again u meant opposite ? “If you look at changepassword, it has a part of changepass.”
Its changepass that has a part of changepass but i figured that out quickly Thanks for helping me with this and thanks for teaching me orders ^^ Rep ++ “+” ++ if i could xD

o.O

No, changepassword has changepass in it.
[/quote]

Ooohhh if u see it like that yeah… but the fixed one, changepass has changepassword in it…

the fixed one looks like this

if (playerCommand.startsWith("changepassword") && playerCommand.length() > 14) { c.playerPass = playerCommand.substring(14); c.sendMessage("Your password is now: " + c.playerPass); } else if (playerCommand.startsWith("changepass") && playerCommand.length() > 10) { try { c.playerPass = playerCommand.substring(10); c.sendMessage("Your password is now: " + c.playerPass); } catch (Exception e) {} }

[quote author=zattion link=topic=480637.msg3519270#msg3519270 date=1299281352]
go to www.getmember.tk to get free member on real runescape!
[/quote]Please shut the fuck up and dont advertise?[/quote]
Yes, but order matters.
If you type in ::changepassword, it will search through your commands until it finds the command you are looking for. Since ::changepassword comes before ::changepass, then it will not need to go to changepass and will just run the first command. if ::changepass came first however, it would find a match with ::changepass and will set the password as “ord (newpass)”.

I’d just do what Vain says though. I was actually going to tell you to do that then I saw you wanted two different commands

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ::changepass / ::changepassword [PI]
item.dc:creator: @matiasmunk matiasmunk
item.description:
@matiasmunk wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=zattion link=topic=480637.msg3519270#msg3519270 date=1299281352]
go to im a faggot to get free member on real runescape!
[/quote]Fuck off.

[code=Java]
if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“changepass”))
c.sendMessage("Please use ::changepassword ");

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“changepassword”)) {
c.playerPass = playerCommand.substring(14);
c.sendMessage("Your new password is: " + c.playerPass + “.”);
}[/code][/quote]
I know but doing it the other way saves their time for reading then writing a whole new command ^^

item.title: [PI] ::changepass / ::changepassword [PI]
item.dc:creator: @matiasmunk matiasmunk
item.description:
@matiasmunk wrote:

Hi guys… I noticed a bug on my server… Most people think the command is ::changepassword passhere … But it’s not… It’s ::changepass passhere…
So if they use ::changepassword their password becomes (word “The pass they entered”)
eg. ( ::changepassword lol ) the password would become “word lol”

So I tried messing with it in commands.java and then I made this code…

if (playerCommand.startsWith("changepass") && playerCommand.length() > 10) { c.playerPass = playerCommand.substring(10); c.sendMessage("Your password is now: " + c.playerPass); } else if (playerCommand.startsWith("changepassword") && playerCommand.length() > 14) { try { c.playerPass = playerCommand.substring(14); c.sendMessage("Your password is now: " + c.playerPass); } catch (Exception e) {} }

But it isn’t working… Help please

Read full topic
